locations.name: Kamshet
locations.description: Known as the hang gliding capital of India, Kamshet offers stunning views and favorable wind conditions for gliders.

locations.name: Bir Billing
locations.description: A world-renowned destination for paragliding and hang gliding, offering breathtaking views of the Dhauladhar Range.
locations.bestTimeToVisit: March to June, September to November

locations.name: Nandi Hills
locations.description: A popular spot for hang gliding enthusiasts, Nandi Hills provides perfect take-off points with panoramic views.

locations.name: Pondicherry
locations.description: Hang gliding over the scenic coastline of Pondicherry, where you can enjoy the view of the beaches and French heritage.

locations.name: Rishikesh
locations.description: Rishikesh is not just for river rafting, but also an excellent place for hang gliding, offering majestic views of the Himalayan foothills.

locations.name: Mahabalipuram
locations.description: The coastal town of Mahabalipuram offers great hang gliding conditions with the chance to soar above ancient temples and the sea.

locations.name: Shillong
locations.description: With its stunning landscape and favorable wind conditions, Shillong provides a great spot for hang gliders.

locations.name: Mysore
locations.description: The flatlands around Mysore offer a smooth landing and take-off for hang gliders, with scenic views of the countryside.

locations.name: Dhanaulti
locations.description: A lesser-known destination for hang gliding, Dhanaulti offers stunning views of the Tehri Lake and the Garhwal region.
locations.bestTimeToVisit: March to June, September to November

locations.name: Almora
locations.description: Almora offers excellent views of the snow-capped Himalayan peaks, ideal for hang gliding enthusiasts.
locations.bestTimeToVisit: April to June, September to December
